triples.name: Microplastics
triples.relevance: The paper examines how different microplastic types and their diversity affect microbial communities and ecological networks.

triples.name: Microbial ecology
triples.relevance: The study focuses on the ecological interactions and community dynamics of microorganisms in lake sediments.

triples.name: Ecological network
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes microbial communities using ecological network analysis to measure complexity and stability.

triples.name: Biological interaction
triples.relevance: The study examines how biotic interactions between microbial species are strengthened by increased microplastic diversity.

triples.name: Microcosm (experimental ecosystem)
triples.relevance: The paper uses 600 microcosms as the experimental approach to study microbial communities under controlled conditions.

triples.name: Network complexity
triples.relevance: The paper's novel finding is that microplastic diversity enhances network complexity through increased connectance and reduced path length.

triples.name: Sediment
triples.relevance: Lake sediments are the environmental source and matrix studied for microbial community responses to microplastic diversity.

triples.name: Biodegradable plastic
triples.relevance: The paper finds that biodegradable microplastics provide additional positive mediation of microplastic diversity effects on network stability.
